image.altText: Two politicians speak at a press conference

props.synopsis: Tasmanian Premier Jeremy Rockliff tells those seeking to support a no-confidence motion in his leadership that if it is successful it will result in a state election less than eight months after the last one.

title.children: Rockliff pushes back on election threat as Tasmanian pokies reform paused

image.altText: A CGI image of four sports ovals and a tennis courts situated next to the urban kingborough area

props.synopsis: After months of community opposition to the once-preferred site for Tasmania's AFL high-performance centre at Rosny, on Hobart's eastern shore, the state government has announced Kingston will now become the home base for the Tasmania Devils.

title.children: Tasmanian AFL team's home base chosen but losing mayor says process was 'awful experience'

image.altText: Three little penguins bunched together on sand

props.synopsis: More than 21,000 people have signed a petition to abolish the permits, and now two MPs from different parts of the political spectrum are trying to get them banned too.

title.children: 'Seismic blasting' near little penguin colonies under the microscope as bill to abolish permits tabled in parliament

image.altText: Teenage students solve maths problems in workbooks.

props.synopsis: Spelling mistakes and incorrect questions have been identified in several year 11 and 12 exams in Tasmania. One concerned parent says it left her son "rattled".Â

title.children: Teacher says end-of-year exam was 'borderline disgraceful' after students find incorrect questions

image.altText: A small baby looks at camera and smiles.

props.synopsis: The wording of Daniel John Ridgers' charge was also amended, from "throwing" to "dropping" baby Khaylan into a cot.

title.children: Man charged with murdering baby Khaylan pleads guilty to lesser charge of manslaughter

image.altText: Black and white photo of a fit, smiling man with his arms around two smiling kids in little sailor outfits, they are all outside

props.synopsis: In 1953, Sherpa Tenzing Norgay and Sir Edmund Hillary became the first two people to reach the summit of Mount Everest. Just under 10 years later, Norgay made his mark in another place of wild beauty â Tasmania.

title.children: Did you miss? ð£ 'He was a legend': A Tasmanian boy's chance meeting with famed Mt Everest sherpa Tenzing Norgay

image.altText: A baby wearing a hair tie smiles while playing with toys in a living room

props.synopsis: An inquest will consider how a manipulative father was able to take his life and that of his baby daughter on the same day he was allowed access to her.

title.children: Man who killed baby daughter at Whispering Wall breached non-contact order 149 times

image.altText: Lawyer Bryan Wrench part of Alan Jones legal team leaves Day Street police station

props.synopsis: NSW Police say following further legal advice, it could be revealed the 83-year-old veteran broadcaster has been charged with an additional two counts of assault with act of indecency relating to a ninth alleged victim.

title.children: Alan Jones charged with additional offences relating to ninth alleged victim

image.altText: A group of people march through a city street

props.synopsis: A proposed bill that won't become law has become a flashpoint on race relations at a critical moment in the fraught 180-year-old conversation about how New Zealand should honour the promises made to First Nations people.

title.children: A small party inside New Zealand's ruling coalition has ignited a nationwide protest

image.altText: an elderly woman looking at the camera

props.synopsis: The crown prosecution in a manslaughter trial says no-one was at risk of injury from a great-grandmother who died after being tasered by a police officer, but the defence says it was the accused's "job to obtain a resolution".Â

title.children: Jury hears police officer who tasered a 95yo woman was 'fed up, impatient, not prepared to wait any longer'

image.altText: The high-rise towers in Melbourne CBD in the distance, with green trees and houses in the foreground.

props.synopsis: The Victorian government's plan to allow the development of dozens of new residential towers near suburban transport hubs will turn Melbourne into a "fourth-rate city", a leading urban planning expert warns.

title.children: Leading planner warns planned zoning changes will make Melbourne a 'fourth-rate city'

image.altText: A drone shot showing bleached coral.

props.synopsis: Large sections of the Great Barrier Reef appear to have been smashed by climate change and cyclones this year, with one reef near Lizard Island losing nearly three quarters of its coral cover since the beginning of the year.

title.children: 'Our worst fears': Scientists warn of damage to Great Barrier Reef

image.altText: An Aboriginal lady with grey hair looks at the camera

props.synopsis: In lieu of a formal truth-telling hearing, members of the Cherbourg community have shared their experiences of life and restrictions in the Aboriginal settlement.Â

title.children: 'Get on board or get out of the way': Cherbourg community goes it alone on truth-telling

image.altText: A family of four on a motorcycle waits at a traffic light surrounded by smog

props.synopsis: Measures to curb pollution such as installing more pollution monitors and pushing for a switch to cleaner fuels are yet to yield significant results.

title.children: 'It's an apocalypse': Smog in India, Pakistan up to 60 times safe level spurs calls for action

image.altText: A middle-aged man staring into camera

props.synopsis: In a landmark Hong Kong national security case, 45 pro-democracy activists, academics and former politicians have been sentenced to jail for up to 10 years.

title.children: Australian Gordon Ng among dozens of pro-democracy activists sentenced to jail in Hong Kong for 'subversion'

image.altText: People holding up alcoholic cocktails

props.synopsis: Two Australian teenagers are fighting for their lives in Thai hospitals after consuming drinks suspected to contain methanol in Laos.

title.children: What is methanol poisoning and how can I protect myself?

image.altText: People walking along a river path, holding umbrellas.

props.synopsis: Locally heavy falls have already resulted in flash flooding across parts of Brisbane, the Scenic Rim and Western Downs.

title.children: Flash flooding possible as Queensland braces for more wet weather

image.altText: Grace Piscopo walks to court in the Perth CBD.

props.synopsis: Nothing appeared out of the ordinary the day a cryptocurrency investor is accused of murdering his mother, the man's social media influencer ex-partner tells a Perth court.

title.children: Instagram influencer says ex-partner appeared 'ordinary' on day he allegedly murdered his mother

image.altText: Woman in wheelchair at graduation ceremony

props.synopsis: Jade McAlear sustained multiple fractures and was in a coma in Royal Melbourne Hospital for four months. She is now living with an acquired brain injury (ABI).

title.children: Jade lives with acquired brain injury and wants people to stop treating her like a child

image.altText: a man in a suit standing, and looking on, surrounded by bright lights

props.synopsis: Among all Donald Trump's cabinet picks, Matt Gaetz looms as the most divisive. Even some Republicans are preparing to vote against the nomination â and flushing them out might be the president-elect's aim.

title.children: Trump's pick for attorney-general has been described as 'worst in American history'

image.altText: Newman Lightning Darren Field hero

props.synopsis: A heavy downpour, hail and lightning which hit "out of nowhere" has left a train of destruction in Newman and the SES is warning residents to be prepared for similar weather events this wet season.

title.children: Damaging storms have Pilbara residents predicting 'wild' cyclone season

image.altText: Flames coming out of the ground with a fire fighter in the foreground.

props.synopsis: Israel has intensified its bombardment in and around the Lebanese capital over the last week, and Hezbollah has kept up missile fire into Israel, even as US-led diplomacy to halt the fighting has progressed.

title.children: Lebanon, Hezbollah agree to US proposal for ceasefire with Israel

image.altText: woman looking through fence

props.synopsis: This global religious sect has restrictions around television, eating with others and attending university. Its members also run schools and a charity that have received millions of dollars in funding from taxpayers.Â

title.children: Former Brethren members speak out about life in a religious sect

image.altText: Man in a bright green shirt with a long grey beard standing in front of a bus.

props.synopsis: Roofs were ripped off and windows "exploded" in a wild storm that left Bill Tanner sleeping in a bus lent to him by a neighbour as other residents of the tiny town of Carinda pick up the pieces.

title.children: Bill's sleeping in a bus after outback tempest that 'sounded like a freight train' wrecked homes

image.altText: Sam Kerr of the Matildas signs the shirt of her partner Kristie Mewis after a match

props.synopsis: Matildas captain Sam Kerr target of homophobic abuse after revealing she is having a baby with her fiancee Kristie Mewis.

title.children: Sam Kerr subjected to homophobic abuse after announcing first child with partner Kristie Mewis

image.altText: Old man and young woman sitting on a sofa playing cards

props.synopsis: Like a good wine, the boomers are getting richer with age. But it's coming at the expense of young people, and one day they might just pull the cork out.

title.children: The Boomers may be getting richer with age, but things could turn sour at any moment

image.altText: An image taken from the stands looking along a pitch during an A-League Women's game with a net, floodlights and players.

props.synopsis: The A-League Women's Unite Round will no longer take place at inner-city venue Leichhardt Oval due to substandard pitch conditions.

title.children: Sydney FC threatens to abandon Leichhardt Oval as pitch forces ALW Unite Round shift

image.altText: A woman stands in a garden, looking into camera with a serious expression.

props.synopsis: The scandal threatening to engulf Australia's superannuation industry has spread to another major operator, Australian Ethical, which has apologised for taking almost a year to process a widow's application to access her dead husband's retirement savings.

title.children: Superannuation crisis spreads to sustainable-branded fund Australian Ethical

image.altText: A man and a woman lean in as if they are about to kiss.

props.synopsis: Jessica Chastain and Peter Sarsgaard star as two damaged people both struggling with the past, their family and things outside of their control. In Memory, they find a strange solace in each other.

title.children: Jessica Chastain and Peter Sarsgaard stun in this tender, unorthodox film about the pitfalls of memory

image.altText: A concrete building reading "Law Courts of the Australian Capital Territory", with the Australian, ACT and Aboriginal flags.

props.synopsis: A Canberra woman who alleges she was sexually assaulted after a work Christmas party tells the court she felt embarrassed and like an idiot for offering a drunk colleague a lift home so he'd be safe.

title.children: Canberra public servant allegedly sexually assaulted woman as she gave him lift home from work party

image.altText: An elderly woman walks with her head high flanked by a man in his 50s looking tired, both wearing black coats

props.synopsis: The children of Dominique Pelicot, who is on trial for orchestrating men to join him in drugging and raping his wife over a decade, tell of their shock and grief during his trial in a French court.

title.children: Gisele Pelicot's children speak of 'trial of entire family' as daughter alleges she was also abused

image.altText: Bee Gees tribute band Best of the Bee GeesÂ announced Colin Petersen's passing with "heavy hearts".

props.synopsis: His death was announced by tribute band The Best of the Bee Gees, who he toured with extensively over the past five years.

title.children: Original Bee Gees drummer Colin 'Smiley' Petersen dies at 78

image.altText: A man in a dark blue shirt stands against a dark red backdrop. His head is cocked, and he's almost smiling.

props.synopsis: Nick Ward takes time out during his national tour with Troye Sivan to talk to to Chit Chat about his debut album, favourite films and more.

title.children: How Troye Sivan taught his tour support Nick Ward that pop 'is not a dirty word'

image.altText: Elderly woman sits on her bed longingly holding an old black and white photo of her younger self next to her late husband.

props.synopsis: When Shirley met the love of her life at age 19, Australian society didn't allow her and her soulmate to be together.

title.children: Chance meeting sparks love story that endured White Australia heartache
